author: tanishqjasoria
content:
Hello everyone, I am Tanishq.  I recently graduated college with a Masters in Mathematics and Computer Science.
At present, I am working as a Backend Developer at a startup, building algorithmic trading platform for cryptocurrencies. I have mainly worked with Python and NodeJS.
I am quite new to Ethereum, i started exploring this field around 3 months back. I am interested in exploring, on the protocol level, how different parts in the Ethereum stack works and would love to contribute towards the improvement of the same.

author: emerald_654
content: Hi everyone, my name is Sean McCaffery and I‚Äôm currently a Software Engineer looking to get into Ethereum development! I‚Äôve been involved with Ethereum since 2017 but only recently began considering making a career move into it, excited to learn with you all!

author: strollinghome
content: Hey all! I‚Äôm Carlos, I‚Äôve worked as a backend/protocol engineer at Dharma for the past two years. I have experience developing in solidity for production systems. This is my last week at my current job and I will be exploring protocols and ideas over the next few months. I‚Äôm ready to dive deeper into the core of Ethereum, and I hope the apprenticeship program will help with that. Hit me up if you have any fun protocol ideas!

author: davidviodes9709
content: Hey everyone, I'm David Viodes. I'm an ex-restaurant worker turned Software Engineer. I attended a coding bootcamp, and once I graduated, I started learning about Blockchain technology. That eventually led me to learning about Ethereum development, and now here I am. Nice to meet you all.

author: rpavlovs
content: Hi everyone! I'm Roman and I'm a full-stack dev that have been doing various crypto projects since 2017. Some of them security related, others are tooling for the ecosystem, and lately better QR codes for in-person face-to-face transactions. Super excited to meet all of you!

author: Deleted User

author: alex.sumner
content: Hi everyone, I'm Alex and I'm very pleased to meet you all! I'm a software developer, I've worked in a number of fields, languages and technology stacks. author: Deleted User
content: Hello everyone, my name is Gavin and I am an electronics and communications engineer. I am also a student in National College of Ireland studying Computer Science, specialising in Blockchain technology. I have experience in various programming languages, including some hands-on experience with Solidity. I am excited to be a part of building upon these technologies as I believe it will bring the internet closer to what it should be; open. Playing a part in making Ethereum more secure, sustainable and  scalable would be extremely rewarding. It excites me to see so many people here eager to build the future.

author: czjp9450
content: Greetings! I'm Chris, currently a 4th year physics student and will begin pursuing my physics PhD beginning in the fall. Looking forward to seeing what people build!!

author: geoff5517

I'm interested in finding solutions to the issue of MEV, if anyone shares this interest perhaps we could pair up!

author: twiesenberg
content: Hi everyone, my name is Tally! I'm a computer science uni student and a junior solidity developer looking to develop a deeper, more low-level understanding of Ethereum. author: 0xdallascat
content: Hi everybody!  I'm Chris.  I come from a investing/research side of crypto since 2015.  I know some Python, C# (finance algo's) and been diving into Solidity and JavaScript recently.  I studied MIS/Econ in college (COBOL, Fortran, C++) and went for a masters in Finance, and that has been the majority of my career, with a pivot to primarily investing in Ethereum in a small LP since 2017ish.  I'm a Gen-X'er who did run a BBS in the 80's and college/grad school in the mid-late 90's....so I've been around the block a bit, but I admit I need to up more technical game (a lot, LOL).  Cheers!
